lines.content: * Represents a deadline task with a specific due date.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a due date.
* @param description The task description containing "/by" followed by the due date.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the deadline.
* @return The deadline in the format "[D][status] description (by: due date)".
* Converts the deadline into a savable command format.
* @return The formatted command string for file storage.
* Represents an event task with a start and end date.
* Constructs an Event task with a description, start date, and end date.
* @param description The task description containing "/from" and "/to" for dates.
* Returns a formatted string representation of the event.
* @return The event in the format "[E][status] description (from: start to: end)".
* Converts the event into a savable command format.
* @return The formatted command string for file storage.
return String.format("event %s /from %s /to %s/%b", getDescription(), this.start, this.end, isDone);
* Constructs a Parser with the required components.
public Parser(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Executes a user command based on input.
* @return True to continue execution, false to exit.
if (arguments.isEmpty()) throw new YeyException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
if (arguments.isEmpty()) throw new YeyException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
if (arguments.isEmpty()) throw new YeyException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
ui.showError("Sorry, I don't know what that means.");
* Handles loading and saving tasks from a file.
* Constructs a new Storage instance for the given file path.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If the file cannot be read.
* Saves the current list of tasks to the storage file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Represents a general task in the task manager.
* This is an abstract class to be extended by specific task types (e.g., Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Constructs a new Task with a given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise " ".
* Gets the description of the task.
* Marks the task as not done.
* Converts a task string back into a Task object.
* @param taskLine The formatted task string from file storage.
* @throws YeyException If the format is invalid.
public static Task fromString(String taskLine) throws YeyException {
throw new YeyException("Invalid task format in file.");
throw new YeyException("Invalid deadline format in file.");
throw new YeyException("Invalid event format in file.");
Task t = new Event(eventParts[0] + " /from " + eventParts[1] + " /to " + eventParts[2]);
throw new YeyException("Unknown task type in file.");
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Converts the task into a savable command format.

* @param tasks The list of tasks to initialize with.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* Removes a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to remove.

* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The Task object at the given index.

* @return The last Task object in the list.

* @param query Substring that has to match with the description of a task
* @return a TaskList of all matching Tasks

* Handles user interactions such as displaying messages and errors.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm yeyAI\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Displays an exit message when the program terminates.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the tasks.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays a message when a task is added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param size The total number of tasks after addition.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.printf("Now you have %d tasks in the list.\n", size);
* Displays a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task The task that was removed.
* Displays a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays a message when a task is marked as not done.
* @param task The task that was marked as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* @param message The error message to display.
* The main entry point for the yeyAI application.
* Initializes the necessary components and runs the task manager.
* Constructs a new yeyAI instance with the given file path for storage.
* @param filePath The file path where tasks are stored.
ui.showError("Error loading tasks. Starting with an empty list.");
parser = new Parser(tasks, ui, storage); // Inject dependencies
* Runs the task manager, continuously reading user input and executing commands.
isRunning = parser.execute(input); // Let Parser handle everything

assertEquals("Complete CS2103", task.getDescription(), "Task name should match");
